text: I'm excited to see what this looks like by Christmas. At the rate you're going, it'll surely be quite rich and polished.

elements.text: I'm excited to see what this looks like by Christmas. At the rate you're going, it'll surely be quite rich and polished.

text: A few full time days to work on it would be good, but thanks for the encouragement :wink:  I'll get there eventually; it's a marathon not a sprint....

elements.text: A few full time days to work on it would be good, but thanks for the encouragement
I'll get there eventually; it's a marathon not a sprint....

text:
My favourite coffee shop is open again, here in York, so I'm getting back into my routine of an hour or so of progress over morning coffee.  That said, I really just integrated the synthesizer and graphics this week.  It is nice to have the graphics code up and running again, even if I will be changing it when I get chance.
<https://youtu.be/mLplFS5WsLg>

attachments.title: Future Of Coding, Week 12
attachments.fallback: YouTube Video: Future Of Coding, Week 12

elements.text: My favourite coffee shop is open again, here in York, so I'm getting back into my routine of an hour or so of progress over morning coffee.  That said, I really just integrated the synthesizer and graphics this week.  It is nice to have the graphics code up and running again, even if I will be changing it when I get chance.

text: If it isn't clear, one of my goals of this project is to provide a one-stop-shop for live coding here.  There are no external processes.  This is a single executable.  I want a great 'out of the box' solution to shader and audio coding.  The challenge that this brings though is ensuring that all the threads of work inside the single binary are kept busy and performant.

elements.text: If it isn't clear, one of my goals of this project is to provide a one-stop-shop for live coding here.  There are no external processes.  This is a single executable.  I want a great 'out of the box' solution to shader and audio coding.  The challenge that this brings though is ensuring that all the threads of work inside the single binary are kept busy and performant.

text: This is probably best watched in HD on YouTube.

elements.text: This is probably best watched in HD on YouTube.

text: I heard a click at around 2:01. Are you still hunting down those issues, or might that have just been a hiccup in the video capture?

elements.text: I heard a click at around 2:01. Are you still hunting down those issues, or might that have just been a hiccup in the video capture?

text:
Mostly I only hear these when recording these days; I think they are slowly going as I find and fix memory allocations or other stalls on the audio thread; I know of a few places where things aren't properly fixed yet - one in particular to do with the audio processing causing a lock.
I found one major cause which was to do with the mixer in the audio path doing the wrong math; that helped a lot with odd sound transitions I was hearing.
If you notice, this video was recorded at 500 fps for the graphics, with my video from the webcam, and OBS running on the same machine on a 4K display.  To add to that, my machine is 'only' an i7 4 core.
I don't mention it in the video, but I also have this app mostly working on Mac.  It will be interesting to compare it, since the MBP is a top spec macine.
Ultimately, performance work is ongoing and will be more focused as I move towards open sourcing everything.....

elements.text:
Mostly I only hear these when recording these days; I think they are slowly going as I find and fix memory allocations or other stalls on the audio thread; I know of a few places where things aren't properly fixed yet - one in particular to do with the audio processing causing a lock.
I found one major cause which was to do with the mixer in the audio path doing the wrong math; that helped a lot with odd sound transitions I was hearing.
If you notice, this video was recorded at 500 fps for the graphics, with my video from the webcam, and OBS running on the same machine on a 4K display.  To add to that, my machine is 'only' an i7 4 core.
I don't mention it in the video, but I also have this app mostly working on Mac.  It will be interesting to compare it, since the MBP is a top spec macine.
Ultimately, performance work is ongoing and will be more focused as I move towards open sourcing everything.....
